title: Meta tracking issue for RFC 1892, "Deprecate uninitialized in favor of a new MaybeUninit type"

labels.name: metabug
labels.description: Issues about issues themselves ("bugs about bugs")

labels.name: T-lang
labels.description: Relevant to the language team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: T-libs-api
labels.description: Relevant to the library API team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: C-tracking-issue
labels.description: Category: A tracking issue for an RFC or an unstable feature.

labels.name: Libs-Tracked
labels.description: Libs issues that are tracked on the team's project board.

body:
This issue tracks the progress of `MaybeUninit<T>` in general. The type was introduced in https://github.com/rust-lang/rfcs/pull/1892. The old tracking issue is https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/53491.

This issue is not for discussion about specific extensions to `MaybeUninit<T>` and only exists to provide links to other places that track the progress of specific issues. If you wish to discuss some subject related to `MaybeUninit<T>`, please find an existing appropriate issue below or create an new issue and comment here with a link to the newly created issue.

--------------------------

The `MaybeUninit<T>` related issues currently on deck are as follows:

- [ ] https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/63291; "Uninitialized constructors for Box, Rc, Arc"
- [x] https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/49147; "Constants in array repeat expressions"
- [ ] https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/63567; `#![feature(maybe_uninit_extra)]`
- [ ] https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/63568; `#![feature(maybe_uninit_ref)]`
- [ ] https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/63569; `#![feature(maybe_uninit_slice)]`
- [ ] https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/64490; `&raw [mut | const] $place`

Concerns:
- [ ] https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/76092
